segments.pli: Aṅguttara Nikāya 2
segments.en: Numbered Discourses 2

segments.pli: 6. Puggalavagga
segments.en: 6. Persons

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ.
segments.en: “Two people, mendicants, arise in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
segments.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya, bahuno janassa atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānan”ti.
segments.en: These two people arise in the world for the welfare and happiness of the people, for the benefit, welfare, and happiness of gods and humans.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti acchariyamanussā.
segments.en: “Two people, mendicants, arise in the world who are incredible human beings.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
segments.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve puggalā loke uppajjamānā uppajjanti acchariyamanussā”ti.
segments.en: These are the two people who arise in the world who are incredible human beings.”

segments.pli: “Dvinnaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalānaṃ kālakiriyā bahuno janassa anutappā hoti.
segments.en: “There are two people, mendicants, whose death is regretted by many people.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ dvinnaṃ?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Tathāgatassa ca arahato sammāsambuddhassa, rañño ca cakkavattissa.
segments.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ puggalānaṃ kālakiriyā bahuno janassa anutappā hotī”ti.
segments.en: These are the two people, mendicants, whose death is regretted by many people.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, thūpārahā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these two are worthy of a monument.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, rājā ca cakkavattī.
segments.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the wheel-turning monarch.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve thūpārahā”ti.
segments.en: These are the two who are worthy of a monument.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, buddhā.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are two kinds of Buddhas.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Tathāgato ca arahaṃ sammāsambuddho, paccekabuddho ca.
segments.en: The Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha; and the Buddha awakened for themselves.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve buddhā”ti.
segments.en: These are the two kinds of Buddhas.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, asaniyā phalantiyā na santasanti.
segments.en: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Bhikkhu ca khīṇāsavo, hatthājānīyo ca.
segments.en: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a thoroughbred elephant.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasantī”ti.
segments.en: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, asaniyā phalantiyā na santasanti.
segments.en: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Bhikkhu ca khīṇāsavo, assājānīyo ca.
segments.en: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a thoroughbred horse.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasantī”ti.
segments.en: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, asaniyā phalantiyā na santasanti.
segments.en: “These two, mendicants, are not startled by a crack of thunder.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Bhikkhu ca khīṇāsavo, sīho ca migarājā.
segments.en: A mendicant who has ended defilements; and a lion, king of beasts.

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve asaniyā phalantiyā na santasantī”ti.
segments.en: These are the two who are not startled by a crack of thunder.”

segments.pli: “Dveme, bhikkhave, atthavase sampassamānā kiṃpurisā mānusiṃ vācaṃ na bhāsanti.
segments.en: “Fauns see two reasons not to use human speech.

segments.pli: Katame dve?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Mā ca musā bhaṇimhā, mā ca paraṃ abhūtena abbhācikkhimhāti.
segments.en: Thinking: ‘May we not lie, and may we not misrepresent others with falsehoods.’

segments.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, dve atthavase sampassamānā kiṃpurisā mānusiṃ vācaṃ na bhāsantī”ti.
segments.en: Fauns see two reasons not to use human speech.”

segments.pli: “Dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ, bhikkhave, atitto appaṭivāno mātugāmo kālaṃ karoti.
segments.en: “Mendicants, females die without getting enough of two things.

segments.pli: Katamesaṃ dvinnaṃ?
segments.en: What two?

segments.pli: Methunasamāpattiyā ca vijāyanassa ca.
segments.en: Sexual intercourse and giving birth.

segments.pli: Imesaṃ kho, bhikkhave, dvinnaṃ dhammānaṃ atitto appaṭivāno mātugāmo kālaṃ karotī”ti.
segments.en: Females die without getting enough of these two things.”

segments.pli: “Asantasannivāsañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi santasannivāsañca.
segments.en: “Mendicants, I will teach you about living with bad people and living with good people.

segments.pli: Taṃ suṇātha, sādhukaṃ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
segments.en: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṃ.
segments.en: “Yes, sir,” they replied.

segments.pli: Bhagavā etadavoca:
segments.en: The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Kathañca, bhikkhave, asantasannivāso hoti, kathañca asanto sannivasanti?
segments.en: “What is it like living with bad people? How do bad people live together?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, therassa bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: It’s when a senior mendicant thinks:

segments.pli: ‘theropi maṃ na vadeyya, majjhimopi maṃ na vadeyya, navopi maṃ na vadeyya;
segments.en: ‘No mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;

segments.pli: therampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ, majjhimampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ, navampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ.
segments.en: and I shouldn’t admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.

segments.pli: Thero cepi maṃ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṃ vadeyyaṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they wouldn’t be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi maṃ vadeyya … pe … navo cepi maṃ vadeyya, ahitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṃ vadeyyaṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṃ’.
Majjhimassapi bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti … pe … navassapi bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: And a middle or a junior mendicant also thinks:

segments.pli: ‘theropi maṃ na vadeyya, majjhimopi maṃ na vadeyya, navopi maṃ na vadeyya;
segments.en: ‘No mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;

segments.pli: therampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ, majjhimampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ, navampāhaṃ na vadeyyaṃ.
segments.en: and I shouldn’t admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.

segments.pli: Thero cepi maṃ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no hitānukampī noti naṃ vadeyyaṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they wouldn’t be sympathetic, and I’d bother them by saying “No!” And anyway I wouldn’t deal with it even if I saw what I did wrong.’

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi maṃ vadeyya … navo cepi maṃ vadeyya ahitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no hitānukampī, noti naṃ vadeyyaṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa nappaṭikareyyaṃ’.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, asantasannivāso hoti, evañca asanto sannivasanti.
segments.en: That’s what it’s like living with bad people; that’s how bad people live together.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, santasannivāso hoti, kathañca santo sannivasanti?
segments.en: What is it like living with good people? How do good people live together?

segments.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, therassa bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: It’s when a senior mendicant thinks:

segments.pli: ‘theropi maṃ vadeyya, majjhimopi maṃ vadeyya, navopi maṃ vadeyya;
segments.en: ‘Any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, should admonish me;

segments.pli: therampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ, majjhimampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ, navampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ.
segments.en: and I should admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.

segments.pli: Thero cepi maṃ vadeyya hitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṃ vadeyyaṃ na naṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa paṭikareyyaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them, but say “Thank you!” And I’d deal with it when I saw what I did wrong.’

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi maṃ vadeyya … pe … navo cepi maṃ vadeyya hitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṃ vadeyyaṃ na naṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa paṭikareyyaṃ’.
Majjhimassapi bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti … pe … navassapi bhikkhuno evaṃ hoti:
segments.en: And a middle or a junior mendicant also thinks:

segments.pli: ‘theropi maṃ vadeyya, majjhimopi maṃ vadeyya, navopi maṃ vadeyya;
segments.en: ‘Any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior, may admonish me;

segments.pli: therampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ, majjhimampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ, navampāhaṃ vadeyyaṃ.
segments.en: and I’ll admonish any mendicant, whether senior, middle, or junior.

segments.pli: Thero cepi maṃ vadeyya hitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṃ vadeyyaṃ na naṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa paṭikareyyaṃ.
segments.en: If a mendicant—whether senior, middle, or junior—were to admonish me, they’d be sympathetic, so I wouldn’t bother them, but say “Thank you!” And I’d deal with it when I saw what I did wrong.’

segments.pli: Majjhimo cepi maṃ vadeyya … pe … navo cepi maṃ vadeyya hitānukampī maṃ vadeyya no ahitānukampī, sādhūti naṃ vadeyyaṃ na naṃ viheṭheyyaṃ passampissa paṭikareyyaṃ’.
Evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santasannivāso hoti, evañca santo sannivasantī”ti.
segments.en: That’s what it’s like living with good people; that’s how good people live together.”

segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe ubhato vacīsaṃsāro diṭṭhipaḷāso cetaso āghāto appaccayo anabhiraddhi ajjhattaṃ avūpasantaṃ hoti, tasmetaṃ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṃ:
segments.en: “In a disciplinary issue, when the tale-bearing on both sides—with contempt for each other’s views, resentful, bitter, and exasperated—is not settled internally, you can expect that this disciplinary issue will be

segments.pli: ‘dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṃvattissati, bhikkhū ca na phāsuṃ viharissanti’.
segments.en: long, fractious, and troublesome, and the mendicants won’t live comfortably.

segments.pli: Yasmiñca kho, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe ubhato vacīsaṃsāro diṭṭhipaḷāso cetaso āghāto appaccayo anabhiraddhi ajjhattaṃ suvūpasantaṃ hoti, tasmetaṃ, bhikkhave, adhikaraṇe pāṭikaṅkhaṃ:
segments.en: In a disciplinary issue, when the tale-bearing on both sides—with contempt for each other’s views, resentful, bitter, and exasperated—is well settled internally, you can expect that this disciplinary issue

segments.pli: ‘na dīghattāya kharattāya vāḷattāya saṃvattissati, bhikkhū ca phāsuṃ viharissantī’”ti.
segments.en: won’t lead to lasting acrimony and enmity, and the mendicants will live comfortably.”

segments.pli: Puggalavaggo paṭhamo.
